intro: Cryptangium cubense, commonly known as the Cuban cryptangium, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean region. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, tropical environments and is often found in coastal areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
